titles: Truth lifting up its head above slander in an answer to Thomas Jackson, late priest of Stoke in Sussex, his lying paper which he left in the north of England / by Francis Howgill ; whereunto is added something by way of letter from another hand to the said T.J. shewing the reasons why it is meet to publish the same at this time ... ; likewise a brief rehearsal of some remarkable passages out of E.B. his book called Satan's design defeated.
author: Howgill, Francis, 1618-1669.
Burrough, Edward, 1634-1662. Satans designe defeated.
notes: Reproduction of original in the Harvard University Library.
keywords: Jackson, Thomas, 1579-1640. --  Tenets of the Quakers in the North.
Society of Friends --  England --  Controversial literature.
